BiblioData.Title: SPECKLE REDUCTION USING A TUNABLE LIQUID LENS
BiblioData.Abstract: A representative embodiment of the invention provides a projection system having a laser source that incorporates a tunable liquid lens and a spatial light modulator adapted to modulate light generated by the laser source to project an image on a viewing screen. The tunable liquid lens is adapted to vary focal length, alignment or position with respect to an optical element that is external to the lens, ability to diffuse light, and/or polarization rotation angle.

Claims.P: 1. What is claimed is: 1. An apparatus, comprising:
a light source having a tunable liquid lens; and
a spatial light modulator (SLM) adapted to modulate light generated by the light source so that the modulated light projects an image on an imaging surface, wherein:
the tunable liquid lens is adapted to vary at least one of the lens' characteristics to mitigate speckle in the projected image.
2. The invention of claim 1, wherein:
the light source comprises a laser adapted to direct light through the tunable liquid lens;
an output beam generated by the laser is used to illuminate the SLM; and

said at least one of the lens' characteristics comprises one or more of: (i) focal length, (ii) alignment or position with respect to an optical element that is external to the lens, (iii) ability to diffuse light, and (iv) polarization rotation angle.
3. The invention of claim 2, wherein said external optical element is the laser.

4. The invention of claim 2, wherein said at least one of the lens' characteristics comprises any two or more of: (i) the focal length, (ii) said alignment or position, (iii) the ability to diffuse light, and (iv) the polarization rotation angle.

5. The invention of claim 4, wherein said at least one of the lens' characteristics comprises any three or more of: (i) the focal length, (ii) said alignment or position, (iii) the ability to diffuse light, and (iv) the polarization rotation angle.
6. The invention of claim 1, wherein:

the light source comprises an optical gain block optically coupled with a variable-pitch grating via the tunable liquid lens, wherein an alignment or position of the tunable liquid lens with respect to the optical gain block and the variable-pitch grating controls a wavelength of light generated by the optical gain block, said light illuminating the SLM; and
said at least one of the lens' characteristics comprises said alignment or position.
7. The invention of claim 1, wherein the tunable liquid lens comprises a droplet disposed on a surface of a support structure.
8. The invention of claim 7, wherein:
the droplet comprises an electrically conducting fluid; and

the tunable liquid lens further comprises a plurality of electrodes adapted to be electrically biased to control at least one of (i) shape of the droplet and (ii) lateral position of the droplet on the support structure.
9. The invention of claim 7, wherein:
the droplet comprises a suspension of particles; and
the tunable liquid lens further comprises a transducer adapted to agitate the particles within the droplet to vary light-diffusing properties of the suspension.
10. The invention of claim 7, wherein:
the droplet comprises a liquid-crystal material; and
the tunable liquid lens further comprises a plurality of electrodes adapted to vary a polarization rotation caused by the liquid-crystal material.
11. A method of reducing speckle, comprising:
illuminating a spatial light modulator (SLM) with light generated by a light source having a tunable liquid lens;
modulating said light with the SLM so that the modulated light projects an image on an imaging surface; and
varying at least one of the lens' characteristics to mitigate speckle in the projected image.
12. The invention of claim 11, wherein:
the step generating comprises directing a laser beam through the tunable liquid lens to illuminate the SLM; and

said at least one of the lens' characteristics comprises one or more of: (i) focal length, (ii) alignment or position with respect to an optical element that is external to the lens, (iii) ability to diffuse light, and (iv) polarization rotation angle.
13. The invention of claim 11, wherein:

the light source comprises an optical gain block optically coupled with a variable-pitch grating via the tunable liquid lens, wherein an alignment or position of the tunable liquid lens with respect to the optical gain block and the variable-pitch grating controls a wavelength of light generated by the optical gain block, said light illuminating the SLM; and
said at least one of the lens' characteristics comprises said alignment or position.
14. The invention of claim 11, wherein the tunable liquid lens comprises a droplet disposed on a surface of a support structure.
15. The invention of claim 14, wherein:
the droplet comprises an electrically conducting fluid;
the tunable liquid lens further comprises a plurality of electrodes; and

the step of varying comprises electrically biasing one or more electrodes of the plurality to control at least one of (i) shape of the droplet and (ii) lateral position of the droplet on the support structure.
16. The invention of claim 15, wherein:
the step of varying further comprises varying focal lens of the tunable liquid lens.
17. The invention of claim 15, wherein:
the step of varying further comprises moving the droplet with respect to the support structure.
18. The invention of claim 14, wherein:
the droplet comprises a suspension of particles;
the tunable liquid lens further comprises a transducer; and
the step of varying comprises agitating the particles within the droplet using the transducer to vary light-diffusing properties of the suspension.
19. The invention of claim 14, wherein:
the droplet comprises a liquid-crystal material;
the tunable liquid lens further comprises a plurality of electrodes; and
the step of varying comprises electrically biasing one or more electrodes of the plurality to vary a polarization rotation caused by the liquid-crystal material.
20. The invention of claim 19, wherein:
the step illuminating comprises directing a laser beam through the tunable liquid lens to the SLM; and
the step of varying comprises rotating a polarization of the laser beam transmitted through the tunable liquid lens.
